s0272.chinese: 眾以美物歸女，而何德以堪之？
s0272.literal: The multitudes present beautiful objects to you, but what virtue do you have to receive them?
s0272.idiomatic: The multitudes present beautiful objects to you, but what virtue do you have to receive them?

s0273.chinese: 王猶不堪，況爾之小醜乎！
s0273.literal: The king still cannot bear them, how much less can you with your petty ugliness!
s0273.idiomatic: The king still cannot bear them, how much less can you with your petty ugliness!

s0274.literal: Petty ugliness possessing beautiful objects will ultimately perish.'
s0274.idiomatic: Petty ugliness possessing beautiful objects will ultimately perish.'

s0275.chinese: 康公不獻，一年，共王滅密。
s0275.literal: Kang Gong did not present them, after one year, King Gong destroyed Mi.
s0275.idiomatic: Kang Gong did not present them, after one year, King Gong destroyed Mi.

s0276.literal: King Gong died, his son King Yi Jian ascended.
s0276.idiomatic: King Gong died, his son King Yi Jian ascended.

s0277.chinese: 懿王之時，王室遂衰，詩人作刺。
s0277.literal: During King Yi's time, the royal house declined, poets made satirical poems.
s0277.idiomatic: During King Yi's time, the royal house declined, poets made satirical poems.

s0278.chinese: 懿王崩，共王弟辟方立，是為孝王。
s0278.literal: King Yi died, King Gong's younger brother Pi Fang ascended, known as King Xiao.
s0278.idiomatic: King Yi died, King Gong's younger brother Pi Fang ascended, known as King Xiao.

s0279.chinese: 孝王崩，諸侯復立懿王太子燮，是為夷王。
s0279.literal: King Xiao died, the feudal lords again established King Yi's crown prince Xie, known as King Yi.
s0279.idiomatic: King Xiao died, the feudal lords again established King Yi's crown prince Xie, known as King Yi.

s0280.literal: King Yi died, his son King Li Hu ascended.
s0280.idiomatic: King Yi died, his son King Li Hu ascended.

s0281.chinese: 厲王即位三十年，好利，近榮夷公。
s0281.literal: King Li ascended the throne for thirty years, loved profit, drew close to Rong Yi Gong.
s0281.idiomatic: King Li ascended the throne for thirty years, loved profit, drew close to Rong Yi Gong.

s0282.chinese: 大夫芮良夫諫厲王曰：「王室其將卑乎？
s0282.literal: The grand master Rui Liangfu advised King Li: 'Will the royal house become base?
s0282.idiomatic: The grand master Rui Liangfu advised King Li: 'Will the royal house become base?

s0283.chinese: 夫榮公好專利而不知大難。
s0283.literal: Rong Gong loves to monopolize profit and does not know great disaster.
s0283.idiomatic: Rong Gong loves to monopolize profit and does not know great disaster.

s0284.chinese: 夫利，百物之所生也，天地之所載也，而有專之，其害多矣。
s0284.literal: Profit is what all things are born from, what heaven and earth carry, yet someone monopolizes it, its harms are many.
s0284.idiomatic: Profit is what all things are born from, what heaven and earth carry, yet someone monopolizes it, its harms are many.

s0285.chinese: 天地百物皆將取焉，何可專也？
s0285.literal: Heaven and earth and all things will all take from it, how can it be monopolized?
s0285.idiomatic: Heaven and earth and all things will all take from it, how can it be monopolized?

s0286.literal: Those angered are very many, not prepared for great disaster.
s0286.idiomatic: Those angered are very many, not prepared for great disaster.

s0287.literal: With this I teach the king, can the king last long?
s0287.idiomatic: With this I teach the king, can the king last long?'

s0288.chinese: 夫王人者，將導利而布之上下者也。
s0288.literal: Now one who is king will guide profit and distribute it to superiors and inferiors.
s0288.idiomatic: Now one who is king will guide profit and distribute it to superiors and inferiors.

s0289.chinese: 使神人百物無不得極，猶日怵惕懼怨之來也。
s0289.literal: Cause spirits, people, and all things to each obtain their utmost, yet daily fearful and apprehensive of resentment coming.
s0289.idiomatic: Cause spirits, people, and all things to each obtain their utmost, yet daily fearful and apprehensive of resentment coming.

s0290.chinese: 故《頌》曰『思文后稷，克配彼天，立我蒸民，莫匪爾極』。
s0290.literal: Therefore the Hymn says: 'Think of the cultured Hou Ji, able to match that heaven, establish our numerous people, none not your utmost.'
s0290.idiomatic: Therefore the Hymn says: 'Think of the cultured Hou Ji, able to match that heaven, establish our numerous people, none not your utmost.'

s0291.literal: The Greater Odes say: 'Display and bestow upon Zhou.'
s0291.idiomatic: The Greater Odes say: 'Display and bestow upon Zhou.'
